definitions.definition: A fine, sharp implement usually for piercing such as sewing, or knitting, acupuncture, tattooing, body piercing, medical injections, etc.
definitions.example: The seamstress threaded the needle to sew on a button.

definitions.definition: Any slender, pointed object resembling a needle, such as a pointed crystal, a sharp pinnacle of rock, an obelisk, etc.
A fine measurement indicator on a dial or graph, e.g. a compass needle.
definitions.example: The needle on the fuel gauge pointed to empty.

definitions.definition: A sensor for playing phonograph records, a phonograph stylus.
definitions.example: Ziggy bought some diamond needles for his hi-fi phonograph.

definitions.definition: A needle-like leaf found on some conifers.
A strong beam resting on props, used as a temporary support during building repairs.
(usually preceded by the) The death penalty carried out by lethal injection.
A text string that is searched for within another string. (see: needle in a haystack)
To pierce with a needle, especially for sewing or acupuncture.
To tease in order to provoke; to poke fun at.
definitions.example: Billy needled his sister incessantly about her pimples.

definitions.definition: To form, or be formed, in the shape of a needle.
